file_content.text: This is a monumental breakthrough!
I have the results from your scanner.
Quick, let me see!
You did it! It works, it really works! Actual teleportation of matter through--wait. What is... huh. Strange.
The teleportation links have to be keyed to specific biological signatures at both ends. You have to reach each endpoint in order to use the teleporter at all.
How do we proceed?
That's unfortunate.
Sounds hard to use.
Yes. It will be much harder to adapt the technology for practical use with limitations like that.
I don't really care.
I don't know what else I could ask of you.
If you find any more teleportation links, try them--at least someone will get use out of them.
I have so much to document... I don't even know where to begin. Thank you for your help--please excuse me.
Actual, functional teleportation technology... think of the possibilities!
Log seventy-nine: Still no evidence of a traditional prison transport system. My theory is looking increasingly likely.
Outlandish or not, a matter teleportation system would explain everything. But until I can get some hard data, I... blast it, end recording. What do you want?
That sounded interesting.
Need a hand on your research?
Oh. Yes, I suppose I could use some help. I'm close to a major breakthrough!
Back off.
Ugh. I've been working too hard. But I'm so close, now.
This prison is huge--the original architects must've developed a way to move through it quickly. Probably used fixed, point-to-point teleportation.
We can't know for sure until I get scanner results from one of the teleporter endpoints. I think I've located one nearby, but with the prisoners running loose....
Leave the scans to me.
I might be able to help.
Really? That would be phenomenal!
Here, here--take my scanner. If we can prove that there is functional teleportation technology down here, the potential... you have to hurry!
Not interested. [Refuse quest]
Yes, well, I'll just get back to my logs, then....
Log twenty-seven... no... log twenty-eight... no....
Straightforward situation.
